title: Google\Cloud\BigQuery\LoadJobConfiguration
name: LoadJobConfiguration
description: Represents a configuration for a load job. For more information on the available settings please see the Jobs configuration API documentation.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The project's ID.

params.name: config
params.description: A set of configuration options for a job.

params.name: location
params.description: The geographic location in which the job is executed.

methods.name: allowJaggedRows
methods.description:
Sets whether to accept rows that are missing trailing optional columns.

The missing values are treated as nulls. If false, records with missing trailing columns are treated as bad records, and if there are too many bad records, an invalid error is returned in the job result. Only applicable to CSV, ignored for other formats.

params.name: allowJaggedRows
params.description: Whether or not to allow jagged rows. Defaults to false.

methods.name: allowQuotedNewlines
methods.description: Sets whether quoted data sections that contain newline characters in a CSV file are allowed.

params.name: allowQuotedNewlines
params.description: Whether or not to allow quoted new lines. Defaults to false.

methods.name: autodetect
methods.description: Sets whether we should automatically infer the options and schema for CSV and JSON sources.

params.name: autodetect
params.description: Whether or not to autodetect options and schema.

methods.name: clustering
methods.description:
Set the clustering specification for the table.

Refer to BigQuery documentation for a guide to clustered tables and constraints imposed by the service.

params.name: clustering
params.description: Clustering specification for the table.

methods.name: createDisposition
methods.description: Set whether the job is allowed to create new tables. Creation, truncation and append actions occur as one atomic update upon job completion.

params.name: createDisposition
params.description: The create disposition. Acceptable values include "CREATED_IF_NEEDED", "CREATE_NEVER". Defaults to "CREATE_IF_NEEDED".

methods.name: destinationEncryptionConfiguration
methods.description: Sets the custom encryption configuration (e.g., Cloud KMS keys).

params.name: configuration
params.description: Custom encryption configuration.

methods.name: data
methods.description: The data to be loaded into the table.

params.name: data
params.description: The data to be loaded into the table.

methods.name: destinationTable
methods.description: Sets the destination table to load the data into.

params.name: destinationTable
params.description: The destination table.

methods.name: encoding
methods.description: Sets the character encoding of the data. BigQuery decodes the data after the raw, binary data has been split using the values of the quote and fieldDelimiter properties.

params.name: encoding
params.description: The encoding type. Acceptable values include "UTF-8", "ISO-8859-1". Defaults to "UTF-8".

methods.name: fieldDelimiter
methods.description: Sets the separator for fields in a CSV file. The separator can be any ISO-8859-1 single-byte character. To use a character in the range 128-255, you must encode the character as UTF8. BigQuery converts the string to ISO-8859-1 encoding, and then uses the first byte of the encoded string to split the data in its raw, binary state. BigQuery also supports the escape sequence "\t" to specify a tab separator.

params.name: fieldDelimiter
params.description: The field delimiter. Defaults to ",".

methods.name: ignoreUnknownValues
methods.description:
Sets whether values that are not represented in the table schema should be allowed. If true, the extra values are ignored. If false, records with extra columns are treated as bad records, and if there are too many bad records, an invalid error is returned in the job result.

The sourceFormat property determines what BigQuery treats as an extra value:

  • CSV: Trailing columns.
  • JSON: Named values that don't match any column names.

params.name: ignoreUnknownValues
params.description: Whether or not to ignore unknown values. Defaults to false.

methods.name: maxBadRecords
methods.description: Sets the maximum number of bad records that BigQuery can ignore when running the job. If the number of bad records exceeds this value, an invalid error is returned in the job result.

params.name: maxBadRecords
params.description: The maximum number of bad records. Defaults to 0 (requires all records to be valid).

methods.name: nullMarker
methods.description: Sets a string that represents a null value in a CSV file. For example, if you specify "\N", BigQuery interprets "\N" as a null value when loading a CSV file. The default value is the empty string. If you set this property to a custom value, BigQuery throws an error if an empty string is present for all data types except for STRING and BYTE. For STRING and BYTE columns, BigQuery interprets the empty string as an empty value.

params.name: nullMarker
params.description: The null marker.

methods.name: projectionFields
methods.description: Sets a list of projection fields. If sourceFormat is set to "DATASTORE_BACKUP", indicates which entity properties to load into BigQuery from a Cloud Datastore backup. Property names are case sensitive and must be top-level properties. If no properties are specified, BigQuery loads all properties. If any named property isn't found in the Cloud Datastore backup, an invalid error is returned in the job result.

params.name: projectionFields
params.description: The projection fields.

methods.name: quote
methods.description:
Sets the value that is used to quote data sections in a CSV file.

BigQuery converts the string to ISO-8859-1 encoding, and then uses the first byte of the encoded string to split the data in its raw, binary state. If your data does not contain quoted sections, set the property value to an empty string. If your data contains quoted newline characters, you must also set the allowQuotedNewlines property to true.

params.name: quote
params.description: The quote value. Defaults to """ (double quotes).

methods.name: schema
methods.description: Sets the schema for the destination table. The schema can be omitted if the destination table already exists, or if you're loading data from Google Cloud Datastore.

params.name: schema
params.description: The table schema.

methods.name: schemaUpdateOptions
methods.description: Sets options to allow the schema of the destination table to be updated as a side effect of the query job. Schema update options are supported in two cases: when writeDisposition is "WRITE_APPEND"; when writeDisposition is "WRITE_TRUNCATE" and the destination table is a partition of a table, specified by partition decorators. For normal tables, "WRITE_TRUNCATE" will always overwrite the schema.

params.name: schemaUpdateOptions
params.description: Schema update options. Acceptable values include "ALLOW_FIELD_ADDITION" (allow adding a nullable field to the schema), "ALLOW_FIELD_RELAXATION" (allow relaxing a required field in the original schema to nullable).

methods.name: skipLeadingRows
methods.description: Sets the number of rows at the top of a CSV file that BigQuery will skip when loading the data. This property is useful if you have header rows in the file that should be skipped.

params.name: skipLeadingRows
params.description: The number of rows to skip. Defaults to 0.

methods.name: sourceFormat
methods.description: Sets the format of the data files.

params.name: sourceFormat
params.description: The source format. Acceptable values include "CSV", "DATASTORE_BACKUP", "NEWLINE_DELIMITED_JSON", "AVRO", "PARQUET", "ORC". Defaults to "CSV".

methods.name: sourceUris
methods.description:
Sets the fully-qualified URIs that point to your data in Google Cloud.

  • For Google Cloud Storage URIs: Each URI can contain one '*' wildcard character and it must come after the 'bucket' name.
  • For Google Cloud Bigtable URIs: Exactly one URI can be specified and it has be a fully specified and valid HTTPS URL for a Google Cloud Bigtable table.
  • For Google Cloud Datastore backups: Exactly one URI can be specified. Also, the '*' wildcard character is not allowed.

params.name: sourceUris
params.description: The source URIs.

methods.name: timePartitioning
methods.description:
Sets time-based partitioning for the destination table.

Only one of timePartitioning and rangePartitioning should be specified.

params.name: timePartitioning
params.description: Time-based partitioning configuration.

methods.name: rangePartitioning
methods.description:
Sets range partitioning specification for the destination table.

Only one of timePartitioning and rangePartitioning should be specified.

methods.name: writeDisposition
methods.description: Sets the action that occurs if the destination table already exists. Each action is atomic and only occurs if BigQuery is able to complete the job successfully. Creation, truncation and append actions occur as one atomic update upon job completion.

params.name: writeDisposition
params.description: The write disposition. Acceptable values include "WRITE_TRUNCATE", "WRITE_APPEND", "WRITE_EMPTY". Defaults to "WRITE_APPEND".

methods.name: useAvroLogicalTypes
methods.description:
Sets whether to use logical types when loading from AVRO format.

If sourceFormat is set to "AVRO", indicates whether to enable interpreting logical types into their corresponding types (ie. TIMESTAMP), instead of only using their raw types (ie. INTEGER).

methods.name: dryRun
methods.description:
Sets dryRun flag. If set to true, don't actually run this job. A valid query will return a mostly empty response with some processing statistics, while an invalid query will return the same error it would if it wasn't a dry run.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait

params.name: dryRun
params.description: Whether or not to execute as a dry run.

methods.name: jobIdPrefix
methods.description:
Sets a prefix for the job ID.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait

params.name: jobIdPrefix
params.description: If provided, the job ID will be of format {$jobIdPrefix}-{jobId}.

methods.name: labels
methods.description:
Sets the labels associated with the job. Labels can use these to organize and group jobs. Label keys and values can be no longer than 63 characters, can only contain lowercase letters, numeric characters, underscores and dashes. International characters are allowed. Label values are optional.

Label keys must start with a letter and each label in the list must have a different key.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait

params.name: labels
params.description: The labels to apply.

methods.name: location
methods.description:
Specifies the geographic location of the job. Required for jobs started outside of the US and EU regions.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\BigQuery\JobConfigurationTrait

params.name: location
params.description: The geographic location of the job. Defaults to a location specified in the client configuration, if provided, or through location metadata fetched by a network request (by calling Google\Cloud\BigQuery\Table::reload(), for example).
